intro: Leptorkis platyphylla, commonly known as the broadleaf leptorkis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its flowers are often violet or purple in color and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
